formalMetadata.description: Document containing a form with an input field and a submit button; when the user activates the button the browser window is moved.
formalMetadata.title: Change of viewport when a form is submitted (onsubmit)

purpose.p: The test is intended to fail because the change of viewport was not expected.

expertGuidance.p: The browser must be JavaScript-enabled. The browser window must not be maximized or full-screen. In Opera use overlapping windows (Shift+F5).

functionalOutcome.p: The user initiated the change of context, but did not expect it to be connected to the user's action.

techComment.p: The actual behaviour depends on the user agent. On Windows XP, the following behaviour was observed. In Firefox 2.0 and SeaMonkey 1.1: if the window was maximized, it is resized before it is moved, otherwise it is just moved. In Internet Explorer 6: the window is moved, regardless whether it was maximized or not. In Opera 9: nothing happens, regardless whether the browser window was maximized or not. If Internet Explorer 6, Opera 9 and SeaMonkey 1.1 are in full-screen mode (which can be toggled with F11), the window does not move either.
This test case does not map to a WCAG 2.0 technique or failure.
